title: Calories in a Vodka Shot
meta_description: Discover calories in vodka shot, including full nutrition breakdown, alcohol content, and variations for mixers or proof levels.
assumptions: Standard 1.5 fl oz (44 ml) shot of 80-proof (40% ABV) vodka, plain, no mixers.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, proof, serving size, and any added flavors; alcohol content affects calorie density. Consult labels for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A standard vodka shot contains about 97 kcal, all from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a vodka shot?
faqs.a: About 97 kcal for a standard 1.5 oz 80-proof shot.

faqs.q: Does vodka have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: Plain vodka has 0 g carbs, fiber, and sugars—calories are purely from alcohol.
Proof level (higher ABV means more calories), serving size, and any mixers or flavors.

faqs.q: Is vodka low-calorie compared to other spirits?
faqs.a: Yes, similar to gin or whiskey at ~97 kcal per shot; liqueurs are higher due to sugars.
Roughly 1 shot (97 kcal); adjust for proof—higher proof shots have more calories per volume.
